info.name: Super Tech Heroes API
info.description:
This API is manages a fun list of technology-themed superheroes, sidekicks, and villains.  It's a really simple REST API that I mostly use for demos and [training](http://apitesting.bigstickcarpet.com/).

# Authentication
Because this API is meant for demo and training purposes, it doesn't have very strict authentication requirements. You can set the `X-API-Key` header to any alphanumeric value. As long as it's a unique value, you won't have any conflicts with anyone else who's also calling the API.

> **WARNING:** Any API calls that _don't_ include an `X-API-Key` header will default to the "DEMO" account, which means that conflicts are very likely.

# Data structure
There's really only one data type in this API: `character`, which is a person whose `type` is either `hero`, `sidekick`, or `villain`.  Characters have a name, a short bio, a list of powers, and a weakness.

### Related characters
Heroes can have a `sidekick` and/or a `nemesis`, which are simply references to other characters.  Only heroes can have sidekicks and nemesis. You'll get an error if you try to assign a sidekick or nemesis to a non-hero character.  You'll also get an error if you try to assign a villain as a sidekick.

> **TIP:** See [the OpenAPI definition](https://api.heroes.bigstickcarpet.com/schema) for detailed schemas

request.description:
This endpoint returns the API definition in one of several popular formats, such as Swagger 2.0, OpenAPI 3.0, and Postman Collection 2.0.

### Response Format
By default, the response is in **OpenAPI v3.0 JSON** format, but you can optionally specify your desired format via the `Accept` header.  Any of the following MIME types are supported:

|`Accept` header | Response format
|:---------------|:-------------------------------------
|`application/json` `application/openapi+json;version=3.0`| [OpenAPI v3.0](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/3.0.0.md), in JSON format
|`text/yaml` `application/openapi+yaml;version=3.0`| [OpenAPI v3.0](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/3.0.0.md) in YAML format
|`application/swagger+json` `application/openapi+json;version=2.0`| [OpenAPI v2.0](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/2.0.md) in JSON format
|`application/swagger+yaml` `application/openapi+yaml;version=2.0` | [OpenAPI v2.0](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/2.0.md) in YAML format
|`application/postman+json;version=2.0` | [Postman Collection v2.0](https://schema.getpostman.com/json/collection/v2.0.0/docs/index.html) in JSON format

> **TIP:** You can set an `accept` query parameter rather than setting the `Accept` header if you prefer. This makes it easy to link to a specific format. For example [`https://api.heroes.bigstickcarpet.com/schema?accept=application/openapi+yaml;version=2.0`](https://api.heroes.bigstickcarpet.com/schema?accept=application/openapi+yaml;version=2.0)

query.description: The `type` parameter must be `hero`, `sidekick`, or `villain`.  Only characters of the specified type will be returned.
The `name` parameter is case-insensitive and supports substring matches.  For example, `?name=man` will match Super Man, Batman, and Wonder Woman.

request.description: You can filter the list of characters by `name` and/or `type` via query parameters.  If you specify both criteria, then only characters that match _both_ will be returned.

This endpoint returns a specific character, given its slug. The slug is the character's name, lowercased, with all non-alphanumeric characters removed. For example, the slug for "Wonder Woman" would be "wonderwoman".

response.name: Get a specific character

request.description:
This endpoint creates a new character. The following properties are allowed:

|Property       |Type       |Required?  |Description
|:--------------|:----------|:----------|:-----------------------
|`name`         |`string`   |yes        |The character's name. You'll get a `409 (Conflict)` error if the name is not unique.
|`type`         |`string`   |no         |Must be `hero`, `sidekick`, or `villain`. Defaults to `hero`.
|`powers`       |`array` of `string`|no |An array of the character's super powers
|`weakness`     |`string`   |no         |The character's weakness
|`bio`          |`string`   |no         |A little background information about the character

In addition to the properties listed above, heroes can also have a `sidekick` and/or `nemesis`. The `sidekick` and `nemesis` properties can either a be the URL of an existing character (e.g. `http://api.heroes.bigstickcarpet.com/characters/codereviewboy`) or a nested character object. If you specify nested characters, then they will also be created in addition to the hero.

> **WARNING:**  You'll get a `400 (Bad Request)` error if you try to assign a sidekick or nemesis to a character that's not a hero.

request.description:
This endpoint updates an existing character. The allowed properties are the same as the `POST /characters` endpoint. 

> **NOTE:** You _cannot_ update nested characters (i.e. sidekick or nemesis) at the same time as the top-level hero. You must update each character separately

response.name: Update a character
